* prashanthshenoyu <prashanthshenoyu@...> [2008-07-07 17:10]:
> Ideally if everything goes well, then I return a 204 (NO
> CONTENT) status to the client.
> 
> But what should I do if some state updates go through and some
> dont? For instance state updation for job1 is successful but
> job2 fails?

You might be able to use 207 Multi-Status as defined in WebDAV
(RFC 4918 section 13), but even with that it still requires
complex logic on both ends of the wire.

You’ve hit upon one of the big hairballs when dealing with
request batches. As Roy said recently, any attempt at batching
means HTTP-in-HTTP, which requires re-addressing all of HTTP’s
concerns inside the batch operation (auth, status codes, caching,
etc), which means squaring the complexity of the implementation
(of both the client and the server).

Are you sure you don’t want to simply pipeline a bunch of single-
resource PUT requests?
